ðŸš€ Wristkey | Kotlin
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide users with a convenient and secure way to manage and generate Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) codes directly from their smartwatch.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Standalone Wear OS app (no phone pairing required) â€¢ Imports from Aegis Authenticator, andOTP, and Bitwarden â€¢ Secure local storage (AES-256-GCM) â€¢ Encrypted WiFi transfers (XSalsa20-Poly1305, X25519)
ðŸ“– Summary: Wristkey is a free and open-source Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) app designed for Wear OS smartwatches, allowing users to generate OTPs directly from their wrist. It also supports phone usage and offers secure local storage and encrypted transfers.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ LiftShift | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide users with a centralized platform to analyze their workout data from different fitness tracking apps, offering deeper insights and visualization of their progress.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Workout log conversion (Hevy, Strong, Lyfta) â€¢ Interactive muscle heatmaps â€¢ Calendar filtering â€¢ Shareable progress cards â€¢ Plateau detection
ðŸ“– Summary: LiftShift is a free, open-source web application that converts workout logs from various fitness apps (like Hevy and Strong) into actionable insights. It provides interactive muscle heatmaps, calendar filtering, progress cards, plateau detection, and detailed exercise analysis.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ RedCoffee | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To automate the generation of PDF reports from SonarQube Community Edition analysis, facilitating easier sharing and review of code quality metrics.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Generates PDF reports from SonarQube analysis data â€¢ Targets SonarQube Community Edition â€¢ Python-based CLI tool â€¢ Includes GitHub Actions for CI/CD (Unit Tests, MkDocs deployment)
ðŸ“– Summary: RedCoffee is a Python-based command-line interface (CLI) tool designed to generate PDF reports from SonarQube Community Edition analysis data. It addresses the lack of native PDF export functionality in the community edition, making it easier to share and review code quality metrics.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ kodus-ai | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automated, intelligent code reviews integrated into Git workflows to improve code quality and developer productivity.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Context-Aware Intelligence â€¢ Custom Review Policies â€¢ Native Git Integration â€¢ Continuous Learning
ðŸ“– Summary: Kodus AI is an open-source AI agent designed to perform code reviews, mimicking the thoroughness of a senior developer. It integrates with Git workflows to learn codebase specifics and team standards, providing automated, context-aware feedback on pull requests to improve code quality, catch bugs, and enforce best practices.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ mussel | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: A general-purpose interpreted programming language for scripting, rapid prototyping, and learning programming concepts, offering a blend of performance and ease of use.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Interpreted, dynamically typed language â€¢ Written in Rust â€¢ Simple and readable syntax â€¢ Powerful expression evaluation â€¢ Supports data types, variable bindings, functions, closures
ðŸ“– Summary: Mussel is an interpreted, dynamically typed programming language written in Rust, designed for simplicity, readability, and powerful expression evaluation. It offers features like data types, functions, control flow, and a standard library, aiming for a balance between Rust's safety and speed with Python's ease of use.
